security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and template directory containing no executable code. All 161 static findings are in template files (YAML schemas, markdown documentation, CI/CD configurations) used for creating security skills. The findings are false positives triggered by example code snippets demonstrating anti-patterns for educational purposes. All security patterns detected (Gitleaks, Trivy, Semgrep, shell commands) are legitimate defensive security tooling patterns.

content.value_statement: Need a standardized way to build security skills? This template provides the structure for creating new skills with documentation, workflows, and configuration templates following SecOpsAgentKit best practices.
actual_capabilities: Provides standardized SKILL.md template with YAML frontmatter for marketplace compatibility
Includes workflow checklist patterns for security operations documentation
Offers reference documentation templates with OWASP/CWE/MITRE mappings
Delivers CI/CD pipeline templates for security scanning integration
Contains security rule templates with remediation guidance
Documents best practices for skill submission and validation
limitations: This is a template, not an executable skill with security scanning capabilities
Requires customization with specific security tools and logic
Must be initialized via the init_skill.sh script for proper structure
No runtime functionality included - purely documentation and configuration

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines using progressive disclosure pattern
Move detailed framework mappings to references/ directory
Include OWASP, CWE, and MITRE ATT&CK mappings for all findings
Validate new skills with ./scripts/validate_skill.py before submission
anti_patterns: Avoid creating README.md alongside SKILL.md - choose one
Never modify skills/_template directly - copy from it instead
Skip placeholder text like TODO or FIXME in final submissions
Avoid deep nesting of reference files beyond one level deep

faq.question: How do I create a new skill from this template?
faq.answer: Run ./scripts/init_skill.sh <skill-name> <category> to initialize from this template. The script validates name format and creates the directory structure.

faq.question: What categories are supported?
faq.answer: Skills must use one of six categories: appsec, devsecops, secsdlc, threatmodel, compliance, or incident-response.

faq.question: Can I modify the template files directly?
faq.answer: Never modify skills/_template/ directly. Copy from it to create new skills. The template is the source for all new skills via the init script.

faq.question: How do I validate my skill before submission?
faq.answer: Run ./scripts/validate_skill.py skills/<category>/<skill-name>. This checks YAML frontmatter, versioning, description quality, and script executability.

faq.question: What belongs in references vs SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines with core workflows. Move detailed framework mappings, extensive rule libraries, and advanced configurations to references/.

faq.question: How do I register a skill in the marketplace?
faq.answer: Update skills/.claude-plugin/marketplace.json to add your skill under the appropriate plugin section after validation passes.
